node.title: 'Miracle I'm still alive': Taxi driver speaks following hospital terror blast
node.alt: David and his wife Rachel smile.
node.description: Taxi driver David Perry says he has been "overwhelmed" by the public's generosity as he recovers from a terrorism incident in the English city of Liverpool a week ago.Â
node.content:
["A taxi driver who was injured when his passenger's homemade bomb exploded in the English city of Liverpool a week ago says it's a \"miracle\" he is alive.", "In a message issued through the police, David Perry said he was \"so thankful that no-one else was injured in such an evil act\".", "British police have called the November 14 explosion a terrorist act and are trying to determine the motive of the bomber, Emad Al Swealmeen, who died in the blast outside Liverpool Women's Hospital.", "Police say the device contained explosives and ball bearings and could have caused \"significant injury or death\" if it had gone off under different circumstances.", "Investigators say Al Swealmeen, who was originally from Iraq and had applied unsuccessfully for asylum in Britain, appeared\u00a0to have acted alone.", "", "
The terrorist explosion was caught on CCTV
", "Still, Britain's official terrorism threat level was raised from substantial to severe \u2014 meaning an attack is highly likely \u2014 following the blast.", "Mr Perry managed to get out of the taxi just before it was consumed by flames. He was treated for injuries in a hospital.", "In his statement the driver said he was \"overwhelmed\" by the good wishes and generosity he had received after the attack.", "\"I now need time to try to come to terms with what's happened and focus on my recovery both mentally and physically,\" he said.", "AP"]
